column1: 8 pts - Identified business function is somewhat unlikely to benefit from scrum/sprint. The response provided a reasonable explanation for using scrum/sprint in the production function, but it may not be the most suitable choice.

Rating: 10/10

Comment: Great job explaining how scrum/sprint could operate for the production function and why kanban might not be the best fit. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 5 pts

Comment: You provided a general description of why Kanban might not be the best fit, but more specific details related to the function would be helpful. Keep up the good work!

10 pts - You have clearly identified the marketing function as the one that could benefit from implementing kanban methodologies. Good job explaining the reasoning and providing a list of possible columns for the kanban board.

8 pts - Missing significant explanatory content. Your response provides a general understanding of kanban and scrum/sprint, but lacks specific details on how kanban could operate for the chosen Mighty Jaxx function.
7/10 - Some vagueness in the discussion of poor fit, but overall a good attempt at explaining the differences between Scrum/Sprint and Kanban methodologies.

5 pts: Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in Jackson's decision-making process. Your explanation and suggestions for addressing this bias are clear and helpful. Keep up the good work!

10/10

Great job! You provided a clear and accurate definition of confirmation bias and offered practical advice on how to avoid it. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on describing the possible problem and steps to take, but some details could be clearer. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Reasonable description, but missing some detail. Your response provides a good overview of the potential bias and suggested action, but could benefit from more specific details on how to implement the suggested step or action. Keep up the good work!
